content: table so you are looking at the bottom poke the needle or crochet hook from back to front top to bottom through a stitch along this top edge and grab a loop of thread pull it through to the back and place it on the needle repeat using the stitches from the bottom of the bag as your pick up guide until all stitches are on the needle this pick-up placement creates a neat frame for the transition between base and body of your bag * note using the stitches from the outer bottom of base as a visual guide ensures that your pick-up line is clean and pretty the inside of the bag is less critical on looks* place marker at beginning of round knit all stitches until your bag measures 10 inches 25 cm from the picked up edge or until 1 2 inches 2 5 5 cm shorter than total desired length forming the top closure portion optional switch to slightly thinner yarn for a more easily ruffled closure i removed 1 of 3 strands for the bulky version to create a lighter fabric at the top p 1 round k 2 rounds eyelet round *k4 yo k2tog* repeat from * to end of round k3 rounds bind off all stitches and weave in ends drawstring and finishing touches for a quick and easy finish choose fabric ribbon not holiday gift ribbon that fits through your eyelets it is ok if the ribbon folds on itself a little cut 2 sections of ribbon that fit all the way around your bag plus enough to fit around wrist if desired gently melt cut ends to prevent fraying and weave one ribbon all around bag tie ends and add an optional knot a few inches down from ends for wrist handles if desired repeat with the second ribbon but weave it through the bag in an opposite pattern from the first ribbon and where the ends land on the opposite side of the bag your bag should appear as if the ribbon is solid around the outside of the bag or using 2 dpn s of a slightly smaller size cast on 5 sts or 3 sts for thinner cord and slide sts to opposite end of needle k all sts starting from 1st cast-on st slide sts down needle and k all sts no turning the work this creates a 5-st 3-st i-cord continue until the i-cord is desired length but at least long enough to reach all the way around your bag plus a few in/cm for tying off weave in ends make a 2nd identical i-cord and weave through eyelets as described in the ribbon instructions 3-inch pompoms attached to the ends of your eye cord add a touch of whimsy to your bag blocking is optional go ahead and start using your new project bag additional notes this bag is quite large and can hold up to an entire small sweater to make a smaller
